oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Spatial correlation of two-dimensional Bosonic multi-mode condensates
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Nitsche, Wolfgang H.
Kim, Na Young
Roumpos, Georgios
Schneider, Christian
Hoefling, Sven
Forchel, Alfred
Yamamoto, Yoshihisa
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Condensed Matter - Quantum Gases
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We studied the spatial coherence of a Bosonic two-dimensional multi-mode condensate both through measurements and simulations. It is shown that condensates with a constant spatial density must be described as the superposition of several quantized modes which reduces the overall coherence. In this case, the spatial coherence can appear to decay faster than allowed by the Berezinskii-Kosterlitz-Thouless (BKT) theory. However, we find through spectroscopic measurements that the individual modes show a slower decay of the spatial coherence than the overall system.
